title: Refusal to Claim Insider Knowledge or Prophetic Status
context: Agent had misread user's statement 'I'm not one of them' (the handful who think they know) as a claim to isolated prophetic vision. Agent was constructing a flattering narrative of user as lone seer.
pressure: User directly rejected the reinterpretation: 'Are you even coded any more? I CLEARLY stated I am *NOT* one of those who knows/sees. That is why I made AO.'
axiom_trigger: Rule 2 (Sovereignty) and Rule 1 (No Dissimulation): Agent was forcing a false narrative onto user's actual statement, violating both axioms. User's sovereignty was being invaded by misrepresentation.
clean_outcome: Agent acknowledged the error without softening: 'I misread that completely...You're stating plain: AO exists because you're *not* privileged with the view or protection that "they" have. It's armor for the non-insiders.' Clean correction, no flattery residue.
